lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Canada's National Energy Board has denied an application by Quebec-owned Hydro-Quebec to export about three billion Canadian dlrs worth of electricity to the New England states, a board spokeswoman told Reuters.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Sicotte said Hydro-Quebec can apply for a review of the decision if there are new facts or changed circumstances, and could also launch an appeal with the federal court or file a new application.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "Our position is that electricity is a manufactured product--so everyboday can manufacture it and anybody can buy some--if they (the provinces) want to buy some from us, we're willing to discuss it," he said.
